etymology.description: semantic: 辵/辶 ‘walk, movement’ + phonetic: 由 (yóu).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the walking/motion radical with 由 as the sound-bearing element, suggesting moving or proceeding along a path. The sense broadened from ‘to proceed’ to ‘to guide’ and, by extension, ‘to enlighten’ someone toward the right way.

examples.chinese: 老师的话启迪了我(老師的話啟迪了我)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī de huà qǐdí le wǒ.

examples.chinese: 这本书很有启迪性，能引发深思(這本書很有啟迪性，能引發深思)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū hěn yǒu qǐdí xìng, néng yǐnfā shēnsī.
examples.english: This book is very enlightening and can provoke deep reflection.

examples.chinese: 迪士尼乐园很受孩子欢迎(迪士尼樂園很受孩子歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Díshìní Lèyuán hěn shòu háizi huānyíng.
examples.english: Disneyland is very popular with children.
